body.p:
To His Excellency.
Gov. Beriah Magoffin

Sir the old citizens of this place and vicinity, in consequence of the disrupted condition of our country, have formed and organized themselves into a home guard, in order that they may be prepared for any emergency, that may come upon them. We are however without arms and we apply to you Excellency. to furnish us with the necessary amount of arms. the guards prefer the sharp riflle if they can get them if they cannot be procured. They will be satisfied with such as your excellency will furnish. The Guards Number rank and file Fifty-Nine. Hoping to hear from you soon I remain

Verry Resptfully
D. T. Porter, Cpt. Guard
Keysburg. April 26th 1861
N. B. Send amount of Bond to be given immediately
